title: 1999 İzmit earthquake
summary: During the summer of 1999, Turkey was hit by a series of earthquakes. The mainshock of the İzmit earthquake, also known as the Kocaeli earthquake or Gölcük earthquake,[6] occurred on August 17th, with it's Epicenter located in İzmit, with a moment magnitude of 7.6, and maximum Mercalli intensity of IX (violent).  The shaking lasted 37 seconds, causing great damage to the area and many casualties.
